Headline: OpenAI & AMD 6GW Chip Agreement
Description: OpenAI signs a definitive agreement to deploy 6 gigawatts of AMD Instinct MI450 GPUs starting in 2H 2026. The multi-year deal is expected to generate tens of billions in revenue for AMD and diversifies OpenAI's compute supply chain beyond Nvidia.

Headline: OpenAI & Nvidia 10GW Infrastructure Pact
Description: Nvidia and OpenAI announce a strategic partnership to deploy 10 gigawatts of Nvidia systems. To support this, Nvidia intends to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI progressively as the infrastructure, utilizing the Vera Rubin platform, comes online.

Headline: Oracle & OpenAI $300 Billion Cloud Deal
Description: OpenAI enters a five-year contract with Oracle valued at approximately $300 billion to procure computing power. The deal involves 4.5GW of capacity and extends Microsoft Azure's AI platform onto Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) to support Stargate-level requirements.

Headline: Microsoft $10 Billion Investment in CoreWeave
Description: Microsoft commits to investing $10 billion in CoreWeave by 2030. This capital injection is designed to quadruple CoreWeave's revenue to $8 billion by 2025 and secure overflow GPU capacity for Azure's AI workload demands.

Headline: Nvidia $2 Billion Equity Investment in CoreWeave
Description: Nvidia invests an additional $2 billion in CoreWeave (Jan 2026), purchasing Class A stock at $87.20/share. The deal accelerates the buildout of 5GW of AI capacity and commits CoreWeave to deploying Nvidia's new Vera CPUs and Rubin platform.

Headline: Microsoft Signs $19.4 Billion Deal with Nebius
Description: Nebius Group secures a $19.4 billion agreement to supply GPU infrastructure to Microsoft from its New Jersey data center through 2031. The deal validates Nebius's pivot from Yandex assets to a pure-play AI cloud provider.

Headline: xAI Raises $20 Billion (Series E)
Description: Elon Musk's xAI raises $20 billion to expand its "Colossus" supercomputer cluster. Nvidia participates with a ~$2 billion equity investment, and the deal structure uses Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs) to lease Nvidia chips.

Headline: Nscale Signs 200,000 GPU Deal with Microsoft
Description: Nscale contracts to provide 200,000 Nvidia GB300 GPUs to Microsoft across Europe and the US. The deal is part of a broader collaboration involving Dell Technologies and supports sovereign AI infrastructure in the UK.

Headline: Nscale Raises $1.1 Billion (Series B)
Description: Nscale raises $1.1 billion led by Norwegian energy giant Aker ASA, with participation from Nvidia and Nokia, to fund the development of AI data centers integrating power generation and compute.

Headline: Mistral AI Raises €1.7 Billion (Series C)
Description: Paris-based Mistral AI raises €1.7 billion at an €11.7 billion valuation. The round is led by ASML and includes investment from Nvidia, reinforcing Mistral as the European alternative to OpenAI.

Headline: Anysphere Raises $1.3 Billion
Description: Anysphere (creator of the Cursor coding assistant) raises $2.3 billion at a $29.3 billion valuation. The round is backed by OpenAI and Nvidia, positioning AI-assisted coding as a primary consumer of inference compute.

Headline: Anysphere Raises $1Billion
Description: Anysphere (creator of the Cursor coding assistant) raises $2.3 billion at a $29.3 billion valuation. The round is backed by OpenAI and Nvidia, positioning AI-assisted coding as a primary consumer of inference compute.

Headline: Figure AI Raises $1 Billion+ (Series C)
Description: Humanoid robotics company Figure AI raises over $1 billion from Nvidia, Intel Capital, and others at a $39 billion valuation to scale its "BotQ" manufacturing and simulation infrastructure.

Headline: Ambience Healthcare Raises $243 Million
Description: Ambience Healthcare raises $243 million in Series C funding, backed by the OpenAI Startup Fund, to expand its ambient AI operating system for clinical documentation across US health systems.

Headline: Harvey AI Raises $100 Million (Series C)
Description: Legal AI startup Harvey raises $100 million at a $1.5 billion valuation, with participation from OpenAI and Google Ventures, to build custom legal models and expand enterprise adoption.
